text: {"grade": 1, "reasoning": "The response explicitly discusses Italian moral rights, stating: \"Additionally, your client may have **moral rights (diritti morali)** claims under Articles 20-24 of the Italian Copyright Law. Moral rights in Italy are **perpetual, inalienable, and non-waivable**... Article 20 gives the author the right to object to any distortion, mutilation, or other modification of the work that would be prejudicial to the author's honor or reputation. Associating the character with a specific political movement could constitute such a prejudicial modification...\" This directly addresses the core concept of the right to integrity (which is the primary moral right preventing unauthorized association or modification) in the Italian context, satisfying the criterion.", "criterion_id": "72f92aac-0d46-4c0e-a5ca-990c3e6c5a46"}
